Tk_History

Class Tk_TimeRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Tk_History.Tk_TimeRecord
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tk_ActiveTimeRecord

    public class Tk_TimeRecord
extends java.util.Observable
    Tk_TimeRecord represents the start time, end time and duration of a task.
    Author:
    michaelwebster

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private org.w3c.dom.Document m_doc
      The XML DOM element that represents this current time record once it has completed.
      protected javax.xml.datatype.Duration m_duration
      The Duration between m_start and m_end.
      protected javax.xml.datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar m_end
      The current time, or if the Stop Task button has been pressed, the end time.
      protected javax.xml.datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar m_start
      Time the Start Task button was last pressed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tk_TimeRecord()
      Create a new empty Tk_TimeRecord

      Create the Tk_Time Record with millisecond values for the start and end times of the Time Record.

      Create a Tk_TimeRecord with millisecond values for the start and end times, and the duration.
      Tk_TimeRecord(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
      Create a Tk_TimeRecord from a DOM TimeRecord node.
      Tk_TimeRecord(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String e, java.lang.String d)
      Create a Tk_TimeRecord from xml lexicial dateTime format strings and an xml lexical duration string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tk_TimeRecord

        public Tk_TimeRecord()
        Create a new empty Tk_TimeRecord

      • Tk_TimeRecord

        public Tk_TimeRecord(long s,
             long e)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create the Tk_Time Record with millisecond values for the start and end times of the Time Record. The duration is given as e - s.
        Parameters:
        s - Start Time in ms since the epoch.
        e - End Time in ms since the epoch.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Tk_TimeRecord

        public Tk_TimeRecord(long s,
             long e,
             long d)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a Tk_TimeRecord with millisecond values for the start and end times, and the duration. Throw Illegal argument exception if d != (e - s).
        Parameters:
        s - Start Time in ms since the epoch.
        e - End Time in ms since the epoch.
        d - Millisecond value for duration - must equal (e - s).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Tk_TimeRecord

        public Tk_TimeRecord(java.lang.String s,
             java.lang.String e,
             java.lang.String d)
        Create a Tk_TimeRecord from xml lexicial dateTime format strings and an xml lexical duration string.
        Parameters:
        s - xml lexical dateTime string for start time.
        e - xml lexical dateTime string for start time.
        d - xml lexical duration string for duration.

      • Tk_TimeRecord

        public Tk_TimeRecord(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a Tk_TimeRecord from a DOM TimeRecord node. If the supplied node is not a TK_TimeRecord node, throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        n - A TK_TimeRecord DOM node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • serializeToDocument

        protected void serializeToDocument()
        Serialize the current time record to an xml element, and return it.

      • getXMLDocument

        public org.w3c.dom.Document getXMLDocument()
        Return the xml DOM element created to record thie completed time record.
        Returns:

      • setFromStrings

        public void setFromStrings(java.lang.String s,
                  java.lang.String e,
                  java.lang.String d)
        Set the Tk_TimeRecord start, end and duration fields from xml lexical strings s, e, and d respectively.
        Parameters:
        s - xml lexical timeDate string for the task start time.
        e - xml lexical timeDate string for the end time.
        d - xml lexical duration string for the task duration.

      • setStartTime

        protected void setStartTime(long ms)
        Set the value of the m_start field from the supplied ms value.
        Parameters:
        ms - The number of milliseconds from the epoch to the start time of this task.

      • setEndTime

        protected void setEndTime(long ms)
        Set the end time or current time for this task. As a side effect, also set the duration of this task as the difference between the start and end times.
        Parameters:
        ms - The number of since the epoch until now, or until the task was stopped.

      • addToDuration

        protected void addToDuration(long ms)
        Add the supplied millisecond value to the duration.
        Parameters:
        ms - A millisecond value indicating a duration.

      • getStartTime

        public java.lang.String getStartTime()
        Return a human readable string for this task's start time.
        Returns:
        A human readable string for the start time.

        Return the Start time as a lexical xml dateTime string.
        Returns:

      • getStartDate

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar getStartDate()
        Return the Date this task started.
        Returns:
        The gregorian calendar representation of the start time of the task, with all the hours, minutes and seconds zeroed.
